example[0]: Phil was in a buoyant mood.
definition[1]: buoyant prices etc tend to rise
definition[2]: able to float or keep things floating
definition[3]: a buoyant market, economy etc is successful and has a lot of trading activity, and prices are rising rather than falling
example[3]: There is also a buoyant market for expensive Swiss watches.
example[4]: Sterling lost ground against a buoyant yen.
